=========================
Models, Hypotheses, and Loss Functions
=========================

These notes seek to establish a precise notion of losses and functions in statistical learning using a probabilistic framework


Throughout, we will fix a parametric model:

.. admonition:: Definition

   A **generative model** is a space :math:`\mathcal{M}`, along with a map: 

   .. math::

      \mathcal{M} &\overset{\Theta}\longrightarrow \mathrm{Prob}(\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y}) \\
      f &\longmapsto \rho^f

.. admonition:: Definition

   A **discriminative model** is a space :math:`\mathcal{M}`, along with a map: 

   .. math::

      \mathcal{M} &\overset{\Theta}\longrightarrow \mathrm{Maps}\bigl(\mathcal{X}, \mathrm{Prob}(\mathcal{Y})\bigl) \\
      f &\longmapsto \Bigl[x \longmapsto \rho^f_x \Bigl]


along with a fixed loss function:

.. admonition:: Definition

   A **loss function** is a map.

   .. math:: 
   
      \mathrm{Prob}^\mathrm{fin}(\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y})\times \mathcal{M} &\overset{\mathscr{L}}\longrightarrow \mathbb{R} \\
      (\rho^\mathrm{emp}, f) &\longmapsto \mathscr{L}_{\rho^\mathrm{emp}} (f)

   where we are viewing data, :math:`\rho^\mathrm{emp}`, as a finitely support probability distribution on :math:`\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y}`

.. admonition:: Example

   A standard example is the relative entropy:

   .. math::

      \mathrm{Prob}^\mathrm{fin}(\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y})\times \mathcal{M} \overset{\mathrm{Id} \times \Theta}\longrightarrow \mathrm{Prob}^\mathrm{fin}&(\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y}) \times \mathrm{Prob}(\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{Y})\overset{\mathcal{S}( - || - )}\longrightarrow \mathbb{R} \\
      (\rho^\mathrm{emp}, f) &\longmapsto \mathcal{S}(\rho^\mathrm{emp} || \rho^f) 

    
.. note::

   Although relative entropy does not coicide with cross entropy, they differ by a term independent of the model, so that optimizing relative entropy coincides with optimizing cross entropy

.. admonition:: Example

   RMSE
